did.abstract: Letter book (89 p.) kept on a trip to England. Correspondence is with English merchants, ship's captains, bankers, and others connected with the South Carolina trade, concerning the colony of Georgia, the West Indian trade, commodity prices in English markets, and reports of the discovery of a silver mine in the Cherokee country 300 miles from Charleston.
